meanings.definition: The central part of a structure or space.
meanings.sent1: The centrum of the flower is where the petals meet.
meanings.sent2: The Earth's core is like the centrum of our planet.
meanings.sent3: The ants made their home in the centrum of the garden gnome.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the centrum of the room, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The glowing centrum of the chandelier caught everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: The centrum of the map marked the treasure's location.
meanings.sent2: In a solar system, the sun is the centrum around which planets orbit.
meanings.sent3: The missing sock became the centrum of the laundry mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the centrum of the party, spreading joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The bright star served as the centrum of the night sky, guiding travelers.

meanings.definition: A center of activity or organization.
meanings.sent1: The town square was the centrum of all celebrations.
meanings.sent2: The school library was the centrum of knowledge for students.
meanings.sent3: The cat saw the fishbowl as the centrum of its universe.
meanings.sent4: Her desk was the centrum of her work life, where she organized everything.
meanings.sent5: The park was the centrum of outdoor fun for families in the neighborhood.
